Name: Original Deutschland Rallye
Description:
The players chose one of the ten routes and mark the 25 listed cities with green pawns (markers). Each player has to get five cars from start to finish. Movement is determined by a die. The players roll for each car already on the route.

Points are awarded for collecting the green markers (1 point) and opponent cars (5 points) by landing on the same town. Cars in big cities (100.000 residents or more) are only set back a number of cities according to the last roll.

If a green marker is collected, it is replaced by a red one. Red markers have to be collected too, but are counting -5 points. Each car reaching the destination counts 10 points.

The game ends when all remaining cars have arrived at the destination. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: COVID Survivor
Description:
A deadly virus is seeping throughout the entire globe and is about to infect YOU! How will you protect yourself? Will you play your cards right? The coronavirus is highly contagious and your only chance of survival is how you play the game!

Will you handle social distancing activities seriously? Have you stocked up on toilet paper and hand sanitizer? Are you wearing PPE? Let's hope so because your COVID survival can go from minor to fatal in just a few plays!

On their turn, each player rolls a die to see if they become infected or their health worsens. Then, play action cards to mitigate the chances of infection, or increase other players' chances of infection. Use PPE cards to protect yourself, and collect sets of Social Distancing cards to take special actions. If you reach the bottom of the track, you have died. The last player left alive wins.

Name: Astro Wars
Description:
Exciting battles in space!

Explore asteroids and planets to recover resources, move across the hyperspace, and fight your enemies across the galaxy.

You roll the die to see how many squares you can move your spaceship or space cruiser, then if you are at close range you can fire your laser, and if you are at long range you can launch your thermonuclear missiles.
 The battle computer will decide the combat results. Red - target destroyed, yellow target damaged, green no damage.

You will need oxygen (to travel in hyperspace and to repair damage), titanium (to repair damage), energy for your lasers and missiles... so you have to visit planets and asteroids to gather resources.

You can also travel in hyperspace... but you risk arriving on a supernova or a meteor field, so be careful.

Name: Cluedo: Charleroi 1666
Description:
The classic detective game! With a historical twist.
1666, the fortress of Charleroi in Belgium.
The king Charles II is murdered, but who did it ?


Une intrigue, six suspects, six armes et neuf lieux historiques… 
Bienvenue dans le plus célèbre des jeux de déduction personnalisé à l’occasion des 350 ans de la plus grande métropole wallonne.

Charleroi, septembre 1666. La vie du jeune roi Charles II
est menacée… Il se murmure que l’héritier de Philippe IV
trouverait la mort de la main de l’une des personnes
de son entourage direct ou indirect.

Au départ de cette fiction, le jeu nous plonge dans le « Charleroy » du XVIIème siècle pour nous suggérer des situations rythmées par des conquêtes, la soif du pouvoir et de l’argent. 
Les enquêteurs ont établi une liste de 6 suspects potentiels, de 6 armes du crime et de 9 lieux où se projette cette conspiration. 
Parcourez l’ancienne forteresse à la recherche d’indices, posez les bonnes questions au bon moment et retournez toutes les cartes. 
Serez-vous le premier à trouver la clé du mystère ?
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Monopoly: Charleroi
Description:
The classic Monopoly with a Charleroi (Belgium) twist.

In addition to green houses and red hotels, you can buy wine cellars, stolen cars workshops, or even brothels. 
The Monopoly of Charleroi has... four jails !
When you pass GO you receive the usual €200, plus €200 in bribe.

Name: Lycee Overture
Description:
The new version of old Japanese collectible card game Lycee. The publisher changed to Movic.
Characters in this game are from animes, galgames and mobile games(such as FGO).
The object of the game is to get one's opponent's sixty card deck down to zero, which is mostly done by attacking with character cards.

Name: Monster Bounty Hunters
Description:
Monster Bounty Hunters is a quick-fire card game for 1-8 players with plenty of different gameplay options for players of all levels and abilities.

Professor Hawkesbury has genetically engineered the scariest monsters in the world for a brand new exhibition in his Monster Park, but a freak storm caused a power outage meaning they all escaped and are now on the loose.

The Professor has asked you to assemble a special team of Bounty Hunters to round them all up.

For every monster you capture there's a reward on offer, but if the monsters escape into the world for good you’ll have to pay a fine for your failure.

Let's get hunting...

Name: Burrows and Badgers:  The Warren Percy Affair
Description: 63 page A4 paperback; contains a two-player narrative campaign for the Burrows & Badgers game, new rules and scenarios for the game, and the current FAQ & Errata.

Name: Undaunted: Reinforcements
Description:
In North Africa, the Long Range Desert Group is a thorn in the sides of the Italian forces, disrupting vital lines of communication and striking at strategic targets ranging far and wide. In Normandy, U.S. forces brace against German counterattack, determined to maintain their foothold in the region. The fighting is intense, and the outcome hangs on a knife's edge. With everything at stake, you desperately need reinforcements!

Undaunted: Reinforcements is a modular expansion that introduces a range of new rules, scenarios, and units. Unleash the might of the German and American tanks and see how your new squad options fare against them in Undaunted: Normandy, or make use of mines, assault aircraft, and other new units as you attempt to outfox your opponent in Undaunted: North Africa. Whether you have one Undaunted game or the other, with Reinforcements you can play for the first time in a four-player mode, or test your mettle in a solo mode by Dávid Turczi and David Digby.

Requires a copy of Undaunted: Normandy or Undaunted: North Africa to play.

Contents:
13 LRDG (Long Range Desert Group) forces cards
14 Italian forces cards
16 US forces cards
16 German forces cards
9 Combat counters
150 Solo cards
20 tokens and markers
1 Rulebook
1 Scenario book

Name: DreamQuest
Description:
DreamQuest is part 2 in a series of solo narrative-driven card games set in the worlds created by H.P Lovecraft and similar pulp horror writers. Each box set expands and combines fully with previous titles in the series, adding new adventures, characters, artifacts and sanity blasting nightmares for you to experience (and survive)!

"In dreams, I have known the real clutch of stark, hideous, maddening, paralysing fear." - H. P. Lovecraft

DreamEscape is the first box set in the series.

—description from the publisher

Name: Get Stuffed!
Description:
Get Stuffed! is a Christmas-themed card game for 2-6 players.

As one of Santa's elves, your aim is to fill your stocking with the items on your stocking list before everyone else.

But keep an eye on all the other mischevious elves. They are either trying to put lumps of 'Noel the Coal' into your stocking to get you fired or steal your items. They will do anything to stop you from winning.

The most cunning elf will win the day, become Santa's favourite and tell the others to Get Stuffed!

—description from the publisher

Name: Larvapocalypse: Slime Pit Expansion
Description:
The Slime Pit Expansion features the 2" Flukebeast Immortal Monster with special rules and two 3x4 slime board tiles. The sounds of combat will rouse the Flukebeast from its slumber, but don't be fooled by its slow movements; it makes up for speed with sheer size.

This is the first Larvapocalypse expansion to feature a 2x2 figure for the game.

Name: Overboss: A Boss Monster Adventure – Limited Edition Bonus Pack
Description:
This bonus pack contains extra content for Overboss.

     1 set of 12 Tower terrain tiles, with corresponding monster (10) & crystal (1) tokens
     2 bonus boss cards: "The Collective" and "The Brothers Wise"
     1 special backer's token bag (purple and gold with the Overboss logo and "Original Backer")
     2 bonus Overboss-themed promo cards for Boss Monster: "The Collective" boss card and "Overworld Gate" room card


This was a stretch goal in the Overboss Kickstarter campaign.  It will not be included in the retail version of the base game.  In the future, it may be available (in whole or in part) at conventions, on the publisher's website, or in retailer incentive kits.

Tower tiles allow a stack of up to three monsters, with the topmost monster considered for scoring bands and other effects.  Tower tiles earn 1 point each plus 1 point per monster stacked upon it.

Name: Sajkab
Description:
Sajkab is a tabletop game for 2 up to 4 players where you will command a faction in a war against the other players, you will call warriors, priests, standard-bearers, deities, you will be able to change the terrain and play reactions cards in the enemy's turns to bother them in order to destroy the enemy portals and units. Be the first player in gain the enough victory points or destroy all the enemy portals to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Harry Potter: Reveal the Death Eaters
Description:
In Harry Potter: Reveal the Death Eaters, the Ministry of Magic leads a group of witches and wizards, disguised as Muggles, through alternating night and day cycles.

At night, the Death Eaters secretly capture a player. During the day, players discuss who they suspect is secretly a Death Eater, then it's up to the accused to convince others who they really are — but they could be lying!

Can Dumbledore’s Army sniff out the Death Eaters before it's too late?

—description from the publisher

Name: Survival Series: Mirage
Description:
During a routine reconnaissance mission over the Gobi desert during WW2, a strange and sudden loss of flight controls renders your aircraft downed and in flames...

Surviving the crash is only the start of your epic struggle to survive.

Whilst swiftly salvaging what you can from the burning wreckage, you realise you are very alone and at the mercy of the elements and whatever else may lurk here.

Survival will not be easy, but you make your way out into the desert expanse, in the hope of finding civilisation, sanctuary.....and survival.

Mirage is a lightweight, fun, solo adventure card game, partly inspired by the retro classic text based adventure video games of old and with lovingly drawn art. Its a great game for when you need that quick gaming fix as it sets up and plays in as little as 10 - 15 minutes.

In Mirage, you must survive for six days. Search the Gobi Desert by placing your 'Exploration Tokens' at specific areas and resolving 'Exploration' cards . These will either be helpful or harmful locations, useful items or dangerous enemy encounters.

Choose areas wisely, as exploring the same place will have a smaller effect on your stats, .....BUT, cause you to be ambushed by a stalking enemy. Searching further afield has a more detrimental effect on your stats but you are not subject to the punishing ambush attack.

Manage your vital stats of Health, Water and Stamina in order to stay alive. Adapt your strategy based on your current stats and items at hand.

As well as the 'Standard' game challenge, you can play as one of several realistic Royal Air Force characters to further bring the game to life. Each character comes with specific starting items and stats. The 'Epic' level challenge will certainly keep you tested to the max!!

Welcome to the first in the Survival Series.....welcome to Mirage!.

—description from the publisher

Name: War & Write: Europe
Description:
War & Write is a series of strategic level writing game.  The first volume is "Europe", which simulates the Europe theater during World War Two.  One player leads the Allies and the other leads the Axis.  There are six rounds in the game.

Players write down his/her commands secretly and reveal at the same time.  There are three commands, diplomacy, reinforcement, or operation.  Player controls more Flag areas win the game at the end of the sixth round.  If there is a tie, Axis wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Merchant: Rus and Lithuania
Description:
Board game Merchantry. Rus and Lithuania is an economic and historical strategy that tells about the life and work of the merchant Guild of Russia in the XIII-XIV centuries. 
With it, players can not only have a good time, but also learn more about the history of Russia and how people lived many centuries ago.
Players can travel across Russia as a merchant: visit ancient cities, buy and sell goods, and if they are lucky become the richest merchant of their time.

Name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – Book of the Dead
Description:
In Kemet: Blood and Sand, the gods of Ancient Egypt war with each other in epic battles using every tool at their disposal. Some are even willing to consult the Book of the Dead, seeking forbidden knowledge of the Beyond, and the ability to call upon darker, more powerful, and more dangerous powers…

Thanks to the Book of the Dead expansion, you have access to some of the most powerful power tiles in the entire Kemet: Blood and Sand universe. However, access to this terrifying knowledge comes with a cost, as you will have to sacrifice your units to feed the Beyond. By doing so, you'll sink into putrefaction, lose more and more prestige over your opponents, and even part with your precious victory points. This is the price to pay for access to such fearsome abilities and the most frightening of possibilities. Perhaps you will learn to summon the monstrous Apophis, a being of pure evil that dwells in the Underworld. Perhaps you can bend the all-knowing Thoth, the repository of the dark knowledge, to your will. If you are prepared to pay the high price for consorting with such dark forces, they will be formidable allies in your conquest of the black lands of Kemet: Blood and Sand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – 10 Obelisks and Divine Intervention Cards
Description:
10 Obelisk minis

8 Divine Intervention Cards

This expansion does not add any new gameplay to the game. The obelisk minis are merely to emphasise the locations of the printed obelisks and the extra divine intervention cards are for shuffling into the main pile for more variety.

Explanations of the "obelisk" DI cards are shown in the standard player aid. (Follow the QR code or https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/225402/kemet-blood-sand-player-aid-en )

NOTE: This expansion is included in Kemet: Blood and Sand â€“ Kickstarter Edition.

Name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – Sand Worm
Description:
Roam the sandy Dunes with a new monster.


     Sand Worm mini
     5 Power Tiles


The Power Tiles are: Sandworm, Omniscience, Night Ceremony, Tactical Reinforcement, Dark Knowledge. (One level 3 for each of the 5 colours)
Each of these level 3 Power Tiles may be randomly swapped in instead of the Domination Power Tile in that colour. They are detailed at the end of the standard Player Aid (follow the QR code or https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/225402/kemet-blood-sand-player-aid-en )

NOTE: This expansion is included in Kemet: Blood and Sand â€“ Kickstarter Edition.

Name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – Sacred Bull
Description:
New miniature and power tiles for the base game.


     Sacred Bull mini
     5 Power Tiles


The Power Tiles are: Perfect Architecture, Sacred Bull, Strategic Hold, Divine Support, Macabre Aspiration. (One level 3 for each of the 5 colours)
Each of these level 3 Power Tiles may be randomly swapped in instead of the Dominion Power Tile in that colour. They are detailed at the end of the standard Player Aid (follow the QR code or https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/225402/kemet-blood-sand-player-aid-en )

NOTE: This expansion is included in Kemet: Blood and Sand â€“ Kickstarter Edition.

Name: Aklasi
Description:
Lead an army to destroy your opponent.

Each player has 5 checkers with different values.  In turn the player may advance one of his checkers by the number of steps indicated on the chosen chip, no more and no less. At the end of his move, the token must be rotated 90° before a potential confrontation.

The goal is the complete elimination of the opponent's checkers.

Proposed with 2 variants.

Name: Safradino
Description:
A dinosaur photo collection game in a park. A course and hand management game.
in turn the player decides whether he wants to advance or take "foot" cards. The first player to complete their goal card wins the game.

Name: Diablada
Description:
Game for 2 players, from 6 years old, for games of 15 minutes.

Tactical game from the Mini Concept range, where you have to form figures thanks to the drawn tiles, in order to make points.

Print'n play free

Name: Burocracia
Description:
A game in which you will have to go through countless administrative obstacles to do a simple procedure. Innovative game that puts the calmest and most patient people to the test.

Instructions:

     Cards and money are dealt. Each player will receive $ 1000 for expenses, stamping, fines and finances and five "counter deck" cards that must be visible to their opponents and which are the counters to go to achieve the sealing of the process.
     The undistributed banknotes will constitute the treasury and next to the leftover cards from the "counter deck" and the "disposition deck" cards, it must be located in some space near the board.
     In turn, each player rolls the die. Take your token to the right place and you can choose whether or not to pick up a card from the "layout deck."
     If a player decides not to roll the die to stay at the window and get a card from the "disposition deck", he must pay $ 50 to the treasury.
     Once the move is made, the "disposition deck" card is placed at the end of the deck. Every three or four coats the cards in the "layout deck" should be shuffled.
     The "disposition deck" cards contain rewards and penalties.
     To complete the process and win the game, you must obtain the sealing of the five "counter deck" cards received without having debts with the treasury.
     To determine the winner, all players must play the same number of turns.


—description from the publisher (translated)


Un juego en que tendrás que atravesar incontables obstáculos administrativos para hacer un simple trámite. Novedoso juego que pone a prueba a las personas más tranquilas y pacientes.

Instrucciones:

     Se reparten las cartas y el dinero. Cada jugador recibirá $1000 para gastos, timbrado, multas y finanzas y cinco cartas de “mazo de ventanillas” que deben quedar a la vista de sus oponentes y que indican cuáles son las ventanillas a recorrer para lograr el sellado del trámite.
     Los billetes no repartidos constituirán el fisco y junto a las cartas sobrantes del "mazo de ventanillas" y a las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" se debe ubicar en algún espacio cercano al tablero.
     A su turno, cada jugador arroja el dado. Lleva su ficha al lugar indicado y puede optar por levantar o no una tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones".
     Si un jugador decide no arrojar el dado para permanecer en la ventanilla y sacar tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones" debe pagarle $50 a fisco.
     Una vez hecha la jugada, la tarjeta de "mazo de disposiciones" se coloca al final del mazo. Cada tres o cuatro manos se debe mezclar las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones".
     Las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" contienen premios y castigos.
     Para completar el trámite y ganar el juego hay que obtener el sellado de las cinco cartas de "mazo de ventanillas" recibidas sin tener deudas en el fisco.
     Para determinar el ganador, todos los jugadores deben jugar la misma cantidad de turnos. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Dolphin Water Polo
Description:
In this action game, the object is for 2 players or 2 teams to score goals and baskets with their dolphin water polo team. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is are a few levers that control the team. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right lever, it will be ejected upward and/or bounced forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. A goal is worth 1 point while a basket is worth 2 points. The first player to 10 points wins!

—user summary

Name: Dream Home: Promo Token – Stork
Description: Adds a new token - Stork. The first player to take the fourth roof card takes the Stork token. It's worth 1 point at the end of the game.

Name: Dream Home: Pets
Description:
The expansion adds four Animal tokens.

The last player in the turn picks a card and places a random animal token on it. Whenever a player takes the card, they also take the token. At the end of the game whoever has the most tokens of a single animal type takes that animal.

Name: Win Immunity: Stop The Virus
Description:
Immunity is a fun and educational board game for all children aged 5 to 75. A game with lots of twists and turns and Great Fun for family and Friends.

Immunity is dealing with the spread of viruses and the actions to be taken of eradicating them.

In reality, when we humans get infected by a
virus, we have our immune system to protect us
by using anti-bodies to fight the invisible “invader”.
Once the threat is eliminated our bodies develop
Immunity against the virus so that the next time
another one attack us we are prepared to deal with
it easily Immunity follows the same rules. The game could be played by 2 to 4 people at a time.

The game consists of four levels:
Contamination, Quarantine, “Cross-Immunization”
and Immunity.  Each level requires different actions to be taken, leading the players to obtaining IMMUNITY. The player with the most
Anti-body points/counters collected wins the game

—description from the publisher

Name: Tenun Tycoon
Description:
Play as a team of business minded people and lead your company and popularize the tenun fabric industry. Build your tenun fabric enterprise from the design, collaboration, production, and commercial side of each player role. Manage fluctuating budgets within the company and lead your establishment to become the best tenun fabric producer!

The game spans within 12 turns, and at the beginning of every turn, roll 5 investor dice. The value of dice is the budget for that turn and is shared for every division within the company. Budget allocation for each division should be considered very carefully as each division has their own needs. The value in a dice is exact and cannot be split, and must be spent without leftovers.

Each player within the company has a pivotal role to ensure the company’s best interest. Executive role is in charge of action points management for each division, hiring new employees, and training them. Operation role is in charge of designing fabric, quality improvement, and material acquisition. Marketing role is in charge of engaging new customers, sales, and establishing brick and mortar outlets.

The game ends at the end of turn 12. The final score is determined by the amount of earnings gained reduced by the amount of expense. Milestone achievement for any category also affects positively for the final score.

Name: Journey Z
Description:
Competitive zombie-themed card game where 3 to 5 players pass through places taken by the living dead trying to survive and fulfill the game's objectives to achieve victory. Each player chooses a survivor with different characteristics and receives at the beginning of the game a goal that is inspired by several films of the genre.

During the game, players face the undead with the roll of the dice that is also used to activate cards that can be used both for combat and to help them fulfill their secret objectives and win the game.

Other locations can enter play, symbolizing the path taken by the survivors. The entire turn, players draw a survivor card, which can be actions or equipment (simplifying), and also draw a zombie card, which can be the undead themselves, or some negative event that occurs on the turn. Drawing zombies always stay in the same location, affecting all players who are there. For this reason the more people in the same place, the more dangerous it becomes.

The combat in the game is performed with the dice roll, where the result is added to the survivor's equipment and skills. Zombies don't roll damage, but they get a bonus for quantity, the more zombies, the more difficult it is. When there is no way to fight the survivors can always escape, which is done in a similar way.

To win the game they must fulfill their objective cards, which have three tasks each. These activities can be killing a certain number of zombies, being in a certain place or having an item. Each objective is different and they follow a short narrative present in the cards. With the three tasks completed, the game is won, if the survivor manages to stay alive until the end of his turn.

Journey Z is a game with a lot of interaction between players, and this can be directly or indirectly, as two people in the same place, even just interacting with the zombies, can completely change the other's plans. Manipulate the result of the die roll, or use cards to gain advantages in confrontations with the undead, but the main thing is to be aware of your victory conditions and know how to use your resources to reach it as quickly as possible.

'-description from designer

Name: Saturday Legends
Description:
Saturday Legends is the followup game to the highly successful Friday Night Legends. This time, you coach the greatest college football teams of all time against each other based on their actual stats.

The core of the SL game engine is based on hours of in-depth and meticulous hours of research.

The game system is elegant in its simplicity that allows you to do what you want to do coach and play games with your college gridiron heroes. Players act as the coach for their chosen team and make all the critical decisions like their real life counterparts do. In a matchup between two players, you each simultaneously select which play to run (in secret) and reveal them. SL's elegance comes from its years of development, using a system of a few simple die rolls and simple math of the addition and subtraction of results when the players look up those results on their respective team sheets. Team tendencies in terms of their breakdown in running vs. passing plays are tracked on the simple score pads. The easy to use individual team chart replicates the strengths and weaknesses of each team. SL's unique and easy to use system enables you to compare and play powerhouse larger schools against the small schools. The fast playing time of 60-90 minutes both allows you to play more games in short order while still capturing the fun and essence of college football.

The game designers responded with adding more teams across the country and continue to meet that demand from game players with the plans to expand their college football team universe.

Name: Cheesy Tosser's: Wargaming Rules for a Village Sporting Event
Description:
Welcome to Cheesy Tosser's a tabletop miniatures game with a fun sporting theme. 
Think Bloodbowl meets the middle ages, a football rugby mashup between two opposing villages all with a bit of light hearted fun. 
The rules have been written to create a fast paced, easy to learn game especially suitable for a fun evening, club or show game. 
These rules are diceless, instead using a deck of standard playing cards to add friction and resolve the mechanics.
Players have a hand of three cards which they can use individually or chain together to activate one or multiple team members. 
The aim? to hit the opponents pub with the cheese! 
Options for multiplayer and alternate settings also included, along with access to a Tabletop simulator module, player roster and QRS.

Men and women have been daft for hundreds of years now. Examples of what can happen when boredom, beer and too much sunshine mix can be seen in our countryside culture and folklore. Village games and rivalry date back to the Doomsday book and still hold a place in our national pride. One such tradition and probably the original concept for the games of football and rugby, was the Annual Langtoft and Baston Cheese tossing. It involved teams of locals from each respective village attempting to cover the front of the opposing village’s pub in stinking cheese. Often participants were drunk and sometimes dressed inappropriately, we’ve all known a village idiot! Records show no one was ever fatally injured, more through luck than judgment. Play continued until everyone was too tired to carry on, had had enough or the landlord of the respective pub could stand the stench no more and offered a truce by way of a wagon load of Badgers Bite Brown Ale and the subsequent piss up to the conquering village. Such fun has even witnessed festive games played using Christmas puddings instead of cheese and decorated hard boiled dragons’ eggs at Easter!

You can now recreate this spectacle on your table top as follows. 
Silly hats and a pint in hand are optional but recommended.

—description from the publisher

Name: Open Combat: Sword Masters
Description:
Open Combat - Sword Masters

Extra skills, abilities, weapons, scenarios and rules to expand your games of Open Combat

The full colour A4 supplement for Open Combat includes:

     New skills and abilities specifically for sword fighter models to capture the sense of drama and/or flamboyance often associated with them
     Extra skills for general use
     New items of equipment
     New terrain rules including: swinging from chandeliers/rigging, low obstacles (trip hazards), improvised projectiles (such as kicking/throwing things from tables) and more
     New scenarios to play including The Duel, For Honour and Brawl
     Plus sample profiles, two new actions, guidance for setting up terrain using the new rules for maximum mayhem and advice for linking games together into a micro campaign.


Scenarios include:

     'The Duel', one versus one combat (perfect for a super quick game or to try out new approaches to creating profiles). 
     'For Honour' where warbands fight for the honour of their clan/school/family in ritual combat and 
     'The Brawl', where we see a fight erupt out in an otherwise relatively peaceful environment (models start unarmed but they can scrabble to grab a weapon as the fighting gets under way).


Also included are hints and tips, Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) along with sample profiles for a selection of combatants to help inspire you (or to pick from if you're a bit short on time).

THIS IS A SUPPLEMENT. OPEN COMBAT IS REQUIRED TO USE THIS PUBLICATION.

—description from the publisher

Name: Attaque Zombie Attack
Description:
In this strategic cards game, you must form the strongest zombies horde killing other player's survivors, making them zombies. Do you have what it take to survive in this infernal world ?

Dans ce jeu de cartes stratégique, vous devez former la horde de zombies la plus puissante en zombifiant les personnages de vos adversaires. Saurez-vous survivre dans ce monde infernal?

Name: Aliens: Another Glorious Day in the Corps – Ultimate Badasses
Description:
Aliens: Ultimate Badasses provides new options for fighting the xenomorph menace, adding even more badass characters to the Aliens: Another Glorious Day In The Corps! co-operative survival game.

These reinforcements will help your fire team progress through the campaign missions, or provide options for the bug hunts. As your heroes investigate the threat on LV-426, they gain experience and hone their skills. Choose experience cards to compliment your character's abilities, or build a well-rounded character to tackle any test. The choice is yours, if you can make it to the extraction point alive...

—description from the publisher

Name: Aliens: Another Glorious Day in the Corps – Get Away From Her, You B***h!
Description:
You've had your first encounter with these bugs, but now you've got to find a way off this rock. It'll be 17 days before any rescue mission is called, and you'll be lucky to survive 17 hours!

Aliens: Get Away From Her, You B***h! contains four double-sided game boards, five miniatures, tokens, dice, cards, and rules to add more ways to play the Aliens: Another Glorious Day In The Corps! co-operative survival game. You can even play as the alien hive!

Name: 遺跡ヲユク (Iseki wo yuku)
Description:
éºè·¡ãƒ²ãƒ¦ã‚¯ (Iseki wo yuku) is a Japanese card game. Players are exploring the dangerous ruins of a dungeon, trying to survive and keep the treasure they find. Players co-operate, but may betray each other in order to escape the dungeon.
user summary

Name: Footloose Party Game
Description:
Play as rebellious teens dancing against the small town’s “no dancing” law! Cut loose around Bomont, from the drive-in diner and the old mill to the honky tonk, pushing your luck to gain points. Score bonuses by winning a tractor-chicken face-off or the dance-off at the Prom. To win, break the rules, but don’t get busted! With its colorful retro look and fun and flexible “finger shoes,” this family-friendly party game celebrates the 1980s hit movie in style!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rallyman: DIRT – 110%
Description:
110% contains 24 new track tiles and 6 new dashboards which introduce two new track types: Asphalt and Snow!

Now you can REALLY go to town when it comes to designing your Rallies and Special Stages! You could have your drivers powering through snowy highlands or maybe have them drift their way through a rural town!

24 Double-sided track tiles
6 Dashboards
Rulebook

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Multi-Era Expansion #1 – Soldiers and Action Cards
Description:
Adds 112 Soldier Cards and new types of Action Cards to your Loadout!

This expansion provides cards for:

Modern Daylight
Modern Shadow War
Modern PMC
WWII Europe
WWII Pacific

—description from the publisher

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Fortress of Nurn
Description:
Your brave company of heroes steps into the very heart of Mordor, and danger is everywhere. You recently rescued prisoners from the slave-fields that surround the fortress, and now, under cover of darkness, you wait for the signal to attack the city and liberate the captives within. You’re certain that Thane Ulchor is also within this citadel, and the culmination of your quest that began so long ago may finally be within reach.

As the Vengeance of Mordor cycle rises to its ultimate confrontation with The Fortress of Nurn, you’ll lay siege to a castle in this expansion’s brand-new scenario. The contest that lies before you is mighty, but fortunately for you, new friends and allies arrive to help you along the way. This pack includes a new Spirit version of Aragorn plus new player cards for every sphere, as well as a neutral attachment and a contract that blast open the number of decks you can create for any scenario.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Hey, Emily!
Description:
Emily and Karl went for a hike in the mountains. Emily isn't really an outdoor girl, but she loves him and didn't want to argue again.
The trail is long, they are geared Karl said. It was all fun until they got lost.

Karl is still missing, it’s been 3 days now.
Hey, Emily! Listen up! He said...I’m going to
find a shelter or a way out, we’ll be fine...

I’m alone! He said he’d never leave me!
I’m scared... I want to go home.
I’ve gotta move now. God help me.

Hey, Emily! is a small 1 solo game you'll play with a couple of dice, paper and pencil.
You need to help Emily to stay alive and safe from threats.
And possibly you need to help Emily to reach back to the cabin where it all started, a 6 days walk from her current position.

Using 2 dice, you'll roll on various tables. Gain, loose or spend resources, try your luck while helping Emily on her way back home. Every day is composed by 3 day actions and 3 night actions. If you survive, mark one day and try the next one.

Arrive alive at the morning of the 7th day, and you're safe.

—description from the designer

Name: Godtear: Keera, The Dragon Princess
Description:
On the outside, Keera is the essence of nobility. But on the inside, an untameable fire burns. Enemies are advised to tread lightly, for it is uncertain who they should fear more— the fiery mistress, or her mythical dragons.

A legend reborn - this set includes: 
1x Keera, The Dragon Princess
2x Young Dragons
1x Keera’s Banner (Dragon Hatchling Egg)
All the cards you'll need to play.

Name: Colonists
Description:
Nice Planet...we'll take it. 
As the master-mind of an alien race you will try to outmaneuver your competitors and reign supreme. Search out new homes for your colonists and dominate the Galaxy.

In 'Colonists', you will take on the role of the ruler of an empire. Your species is generally peaceful, but overpopulation can lead to civil unrest, and outright war. Competition is high for favorable conditions, and habitable planets.

Based off the game engine in Plenty of Fish in the Sea?

—description from the designer

Name: かぐや姫を笑わせて (Kaguya hime wo warawasete)
Scents and Sensibility
Description:
Scents and Sensibility is a engine building and deconstruction game in which players are hedgehogs running a flower shop. Players pick flowers, make bouquets, and gain loyal customers, but must choose the right times to sell off their bouquets to get the most out of them before they're gone.

Can you run the best flower shop and gain the most customers?

—description from the publisher

Name: TOKYO TSUKIJI: EXPANSION
Description:
Tokyo Tsukiji Expansion adds to the unique modular system of Tokyo Tsukiji Market, with brand new fishing opportunities and external economic engines!

With 6 new fish markets and 6 new external markets, you'll be able to rent ships, hold a foreign auction, purchase research into new fish, and much more. Endless possibilities await when you add this brand new expansion to Tokyo Tsukiji Market!

Name: TOKYO METRO: OSAKA METRO EXPANSION
Description:
Osaka Metro Expansion adds the map of the Osaka Metro system and a whole new set of unique action cards to the Tokyo Metro game system!

This punchier, tighter, and quicker take on the game also grants modularity as you can swap out the whole set of action cards from either map to play with the other!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hard Quiz: The Game
Description:
The game is played in four rounds. One player acts as quizmaster. The other players choose an card making them “experts” in their chosen categories. All players are eligible to answer any question in this round by signaling that one is ready to answer. Correctly answering a question in which you are the expert advances your pawn one space on the scoring track. The reward is doubled if you are not the “expert.” An incorrect response means a player must retreat one space on the scoring track.

The second round is called Tom’s Round (after the show’s host, Tom Gleeson). All questions are multiple choice about a random category. Players secretly select their responses. Correct responses are worth an assigned value. There is on penalty for an incorrect response.

The third round is called The People’s Round. Questions are about multiple subjects and rewards. Players may signal when they are ready to respond but will be penalized for giving an incorrect response. The two top scorers at the end of this round will move on to the final round: The Hard-Off.

In the Hard-Off Round, the players choose new expert categories and the player who gets the higher score is crowned Hard Quiz champion.

Hard Quiz: The Game is based on a popular Australian television quiz show.

—description paraphrased from the publisher

Name: Airline Jet Pilots Game
Description:
"Educational, entertaining and challenging" - a roll of two dice each turn determines if your jet plane moves to one of 54 cities on the map of the United States or remains idle due to a mishap!

Up to four players use their flight schedules and dice to determine where they will fly and therefore how many miles they can log each turn. A large map assists with the colorful airplane placement for each player on their turn each round.

A designated "flight captain pilot" is a player as well but is also nominally in charge of each game - their extra duties include controlling the game, assisting with the flight milage sheets, map and ensuring correct logging of milage by all players as well as assessing penalties for logging false data. They also determine at the start of the game how many rounds the game will comprise - 4, 6, 8, 10, etc.

Player rolls may result in no milage for a pilot's turn due to fog, illness, hijackings, FAA inspections and more, as described on their individual flight schedule. On the last round after everyone has had their turn, the pilot with the most logged miles wins the game!

Name: Tawantinsuyu: The Inca Empire – Tantrum House Promo Tiles
Description:
2 promotional tiles that were obtainable through the "Tantrum House Board Game Media: Season 7" Kickstarter campaign.

Adds 1 Passive Building and 1 Production Building to the game.

Passive Building
Tile ID: Z21
Cost: 1 corn, 1 stone
Effect: When you place a Priest, you may convert a potato to a gold.

Production Building
Tile ID: P21
Cost: 2 corn, 1 stone
Effect: 1 gold, 1 corn, 1 stone

Name: Underwater Cities: MvM Island Facility Promo Card
Description:
Promotional card offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter".

In Production phase you may use 1 of your displayed action cards. It could be used or unused already. You receive 1 VP in addition.

Name: Maracaibo: Own Monument Promo Card
Description:
Promotional card offered by the "Man Vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter". Also included in Maracaibo: The Uprising expansion.

Cost: 22 doublons (the MvM promo and "The Uprising" version is 22, but the French version is 18; the publisher states that 22 is the official version)

Card effect when played: All Noble Ranks x 2 VP

Name: Espalier
Description:
Espalier is a simultaneous play, family-friendly experience that turns the tile-placement genre upside-down. The game artfully grafts a gardening theme to the tile-laying mechanic with its simple concept and intense strategy. Feel the tension as your branches line up (or not!) and you compete to make the most fruitful tree in the garden.

Three easy steps to play:

     Pick up and place tiles
     Buy and grow fruit
     Compete to achieve Garden Goals


Endless possibilities:

     Every tree is unique in every game
     Variable setup dramatically changes strategy in each playthrough


Quick game time:

     Consistently rapid games regardless of player count


Options for everyone:

     Challenging solo player mode
     Simple beginner variants for new players


—description from the publisher

Name: Blasted Planets Skirmish
Description:
Blasted Planets Skirmish, is basically a set of house rules a few friends and I use to play games with my Sci-Fi figures. I am not trying to model a "Hard" Sci-Fi environment here. I'm borrowing as much from Horror and Fantasy as I am from Sci-Fi. I mean how serious can you be. When you have, Dog headed, Gator men chasing an Elephant guy around an Omni Field generating White rabbit? There is enough "real" world framework here that basic tactics work (most of the time). But enough of a fantastical element that you really can't count on the idea that the Fin headed alien with the pin gun is going to nail the cave man with the rock every time.

One thing for sure is I am not even trying to come up with a back story for this nonsense. That of course does not mean that you can't. Half or maybe even more than half of the fun of this game is cooking up an army before the game that that functions in some strange way that will confuse or irritate your opponent. If we had a back-story or universal framework that would on some levels really blow that idea out of the water.

On another note the rule formatting is kind of weird. I'm not pretending that it is clever, it's just a reflection of the way my mind works and how I make sense out of things. But I think that it is comprehensible to most "Wargamers" the phrasing in some cases is really tortured. You can thank the fact, that several of my buddies are Super competitors, for this. When you run in to a sentence or paragraph that feels like you are creeping through a minefield there is a real good chance some egregious abuse on the table of an earlier phrasing, required some careful phraseology. The guys you play with may not need this sort of structure. But most of the guys I play with are (at least when rules interpretation is concerned) fundamentally evil in nature. I'm not talking about your basic hearty laugh at a handicapped person trying to struggle to their feet in the grocery aisle after a fall from the wheel chair. I'm talking about the type of stuff that ensures most of these guys will probably spend a good part of eternity as consultants at the right hand of Satan himself. By reading the rules especially some, special abilities and the way they can be combined, and looking at my figures you can probably and rightly conclude that I have my own share of disturbing thoughts. But half of the time these guys leave me feeling like I'm Bo Peep in John Wayne Gacey's crawl space. I'm mentioning all this not as an excuse, but as an explanation as to why the rules are written the way that they are. I mean, I have to be able, when these guys try something particularly twisted, to say, "that?s clearly not, what the intention of that rule is." Of course the easy way out is just always pointing out, that these rules are a perpetually open Beta project.

So that is why we have the Blasted Planets Forum. I am going to do my best to check in at least every couple of days and try to respond to any questions or ideas you all may have. We have played enough games over the years that I know that with the right approach it is possible to play a game with these rules with out any mid game re writes. That is not to say that there are no re-write artifacts in the rules and that the punctuation all works right. If you run in to a problem and come up with a solution for it, please go ahead and post it to the forum. An important thing to remember though is that with all the possible Special ability combinations it is quite possible to come up with an army that just won't work against the enemy you are facing. No matter how hard you try and no matter how well you roll the dice. If you use 600pt armies on a 4x4 or 4x5 table you can probably knock out a couple of games in an after noon. One thing I have always enjoyed is playing two games with the same armies and table set up but giving each player a chance to play each side. This is especially gratifying if one player has gone in to full on Gloat mode after defeating a thoroughly outclassed opposing army.

One last thing is a note on terrain; the rules as written cover use of flat top contours for elevation. I know that not every one uses this type of terrain. So Line of site line of fire rules are probably the thing that will most often have to be adapted to whatever you happen to use. I have written no rules for the use of buildings so knock yourself out in that area. I have some nice buildings but have not figured out as way to use them that I like in this type of games. All the other games I play use built up areas rather than individual buildings and I do not think that that fits well with Blasted Planets Skirmish.

—description from the designer

Name: Judge Dredd: Specialist Judges
Description:
Some Judges display an affinity with machines, an understanding of the workings of the human body, or display psionic talents. Such individuals are given special training and access to advanced curricula.

Psi Division moulds cadets displaying psychic talents into Psi-Judges, who bring the Law to the Mega-City in less than conventional ways.

Tek Judges maintain the Justice Department’s vehicles, weapons and other equipment while also aiding with forensics, technological threats, and advanced intrusion techniques.

Med Judges aid Judges, civilians and perpetrators injured in Justice Department operations, often from special quick reaction ambulance units.

Recent Justice Department casualties have been so great that the controversial Mechanismo robot Judges, with full judicial authority, were created by Tek Division.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Judge Dredd Miniature Game (Warlord Games)

Name: Glen More II: Chronicles – Highland Games
Description:
Glen More II: Highland Games expands Glen More II: Chronicles thanks to the inclusion of three new chronicles and a solo mode.

In Feasts & Follies, players try to outwit the opposing clan chiefs in order to win the upcoming end-of-round scoring by hosting great festivities first.

Sticks & Stones, in which the champions of the players compete against each other on the new Highland Games board to take the lead in a new scoring category.

Funtails Development expands the possibilities of the popular Overbuild Tiles many times over with the new Monuments in Plan & Prosper.

Not only are these new Chronicles supported by the extensive Solo Mode by Automa Factory, but also the base game and a total of 11 Chronicles. '

Name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Darkness
Description: The Edge: Dawnfall – Darkness expansion adds new material to The Edge: Dawnfall base game, specifically 15 miniatures, 12 artifact miniatures, 80 faction cards, and 57 faction tokens.

Name: Celeste
Description:
Celeste is the first roll & write game of a new Spanish publisher dedicated exclusively to roll & write games that will be edited in digital format, that is, the games are sold in pdf format.

A game to play alone or up to 4 players, with games of about 15 minutes.
It contains 2 versions, one full color and another low ink, for those who want to save ink, you will only need a few colored markers and 6-sided dice, print and if you want to plasticize and play.

You must build different constellations with the union of different stars or simply stars, and whoever gets the most points will win.

Name: Operation Storm-333
Description:
Operation Storm-333 is a solitaire game depicting the 1979 Soviet coup in Kabul that initiated the Afghan-Soviet War. The game consists of two phases: the Planning Phase and the Execution Phase.

During the Planning Phase, the player recruits and uses Key Leaders from the KGB, GRU, and the Army to mobilize tactical units for 8 specific targets, collect intelligence, perform special tasks, and conduct rehearsals. Random events and player activities may affect the level of operational support from the Power Ministries, the alert level of the Afghan defenders, and the intelligence available on each target.

At the conclusion of the Planning Phase, the player starts the Execution Phase. During this phase, the player completes 8 tactical missions with the assigned Key Leaders and tactical units in sequential order on point-2-point maps. A unique version of chit-activation determines initiative to ensure a fluid combat system. The player has at their disposal KGB spetsnaz, GRU special troops, and Airborne (VDV) infantry and armored fighting vehicles.

Victory points are measured by the views of Politburo, General Staff, GRU, KGB, the Afghan Government, the Afghan people, the United States, and the international community on the operation's outcome.

-description from designer

Name: Athena's Garden
Description:
Athena's Garden is a game of magical plants for 2-4 players. In this game, players set traps in the deck for other players to fall into, forcing them to lose cards or sometimes causing you to gain cards. But you can also cast a wide range spells to tip the odds in your favour by migrating enemy plants or boosting your hand size.

The aim of the game is to be the last one standing by forcing your opponents to lose cards from picking up your face up plants. If they run out of cards, they are eliminated.

The game gets more and more intense as you go through the game, as the amount of face up plants increase and the amount of safe cards you can draw deplete...

—description from the publisher

Name: TKKG Gangsterjagd
Description:
The tactical chase for clever detectives
A jewel thief is up to mischief and has already robbed several villas! A case for TKKG, who swarm out in two teams at night and try to catch the thief.

- - - - -

Die taktische Verfolgungsjagd für clevere Detektive
Weitere Produktinformationen
Helle Aufregung in der Millionenstadt: Ein Juwelendieb treibt sein Unwesen und hat schon mehrere Villen ausgeraubt!
Ein Fall für TKKG, die nachts in zwei Teams ausschwärmen und versuchen, den Dieb zu schnappen.
Vorausschauendes Denken ist gefragt – sowohl für den Spieler, der die Rolle des Gangsters übernimmt, als auch für die Spieler, die beide TKKG Teams bewegen. Zahlenchips geben dabei vor, wie weit gezogen werden darf.
Ziel von TKKG ist es, genau auf das Feld des Diebes zu gelangen und ihn somit zu schnappen. Der Dieb gewinnt dagegen, wenn es ihm gelingt, an die Beute in allen vier Villen zu kommen.
Die TKKG Gangsterjagd ist ein taktisches Detektivspiel für clevere TKKG Fans ab 8 Jahren.

Name: Mézvadászat
Description:
Simple strategy game for every family members. In this game you can make a field with flowers. On this field your bee-family make honey.

- - - - -

A méhek azon szorgoskodnak, hogy nektárt gyÅ±jtsenek a virágokból és azt a kaptárba vigyék. Ott építenek belÅ‘le méhsejteket. Ez kicsit sem egyszerÅ±, mert a nektárt át kell válogatni. Az is elÅ‘fordul, hogy a méhek a közeli cukorkagyárból is elcsennek egy kis édes italt. A méznek ilyenkor szokatlanná válik az színe. A játék a mézért olyan logikai játék, amelyben a játékosok igyekeznek minél több pontot szerezni. Ennek érdekében kétoldalas, háromágú elemeket helyeznek az épülÅ‘ rendszerhez úgy, hogy a jelek passzoljanak egymáshoz. Az a méh, amely a legnagyobb és a legtisztább méhsejtet készíti, a kaptár vezetÅ‘je lesz.

Name: A NÉBIH küldetés
Description: You can be a NÉBIH inspector! NÉBIH is a hungarian inspection organization, the Nemzeti Élelmiszer-BIztonsági Hivatal, in english National Food Safety Agency. In A NÉBIH küldetés everybody can be inspector in restaurants, animal farms, etc.

Name: Helppp Me
Description:
Helppp Me is a hand management, draw and discard, resource control game for 2-4 players using actions and character ability to get the most resource and rescue creatures in the underworld.

In the game, there are 4 races of creatures: Vampire, Mummy, Zombie and Werewolf. Each race has 6 different identities, from baby, child … to the king. On the Player’s turn, there are two actions you can choose:1.) Play a card in his front to form a waiting rescue zone. 2.) Discard a card to help the player get 2 first aid kits tokens to rescue creatures, but be aware, the creature who gets discarded will curse your whole team with his race’s skill. Will you be able to save the most creatures in this difficult circumstance?

The game lasts until all the first aid kits tokens are taken. The winner is the player with the  most points.

—description from the designer

Name: Deep State: Global Conspiracy
Description:
The Global Conspiracy expansion extends your experience of Deep State and consists of 4 modules you may add into the game in any combination you like.

Some Modules contain Projects and mini-expansions which can be added to the game separately.

All Modules and mini-expansions, with a few restrictions, work great with each other. Yet some work better than others. Recommendations are provided in the rules.

1. STRONG-ARM TACTICS MODULE

Consists of: Counter-Terrorism Project * Black Operations. XXI Century mini-expansion - 7 cards * 3 Treaty cards

The World: The Counter-Terrorism Project exploits the people’s fear of terrorism in order to concentrate absolute power in the hands of counter-terrorism organizations.

Black Operations: it might seem they have no other purpose than chaos and destruction. In fact, they change the rules. The winner will earn the ruins of the world, but it will be their ruins.

Gameplay: You discard cards to Advance in Counter-Terrorism. As a benefit, you may use Agents from your Recruitment Pool when Infiltrating an Objective or Carrying out a Covert Operation. Additionally, you eliminate your opponent's Agents while Advancing in the Project.

Black Operations are another type of Covert Operations. They require less Agents, but you discard your cards to conduct them. You Carry out Black Operations in order - Cyber Threat first, then Eco Terrorism, and finally Blackout.

2. FOURTH ESTATE MODULE

Consists of: Global Media Project * Trends mini-expansion - 6 cards * 3 Treaty cards

The World: The Global Media Project uses the media to lead the average person to the appropriate points of a view.

Social-political currents (Trends) usually originate in a highly influential country, and then like wind spread around the world. Trends should be anticipated and plans adjusted — done neither earlier nor later than necessary.

Gameplay: The Global Media Project requires you to sacrifice Treaties you have already made. But with this high cost, comes big benefits. Each time you advance in Global Media, you capture an Objective card. AND at the end of the game one of your Supreme Power cards generates MUCH more Influence for select Objective cards you have made.

Each Trend provides useful advantages for the duration of a game round and may be captured for Influence.

3. REPTILOIDS MODULE

Consists of: Reptiloid Project * 15 Reptiloid Objective cards * 3 Treaty cards * 3 Contactee cards (Men of Action) * 1 UFO Hysteria card (Trend).

The World: With the Reptiloids Module, Deep State takes a step into a fictional aspect of conspiracy theories. The ambitions of the ‘Committee’ on becoming a secret world government have become meaningless since the lizard-like aliens from the planet Nibiru are closer than ever to seizing power on Earth.

Gameplay: Reptiloids Project effectively replaces the Deep State Project. Players compete for Reptiloid Objective cards that allow them to make new Treaties while ignoring their conditions, and they Advance in Reptiloids Project in order to obtain new Treaties and gather Influence at the end — but only if they have enough Special Interest emblems on their cards!

4. SUPERIORITY DOCTRINE MODULE

Consists of: Nuclear Power, Worldwide Bank, and World, Inc. Projects

Gameplay: Each of these Projects replaces one of the base game Projects. Nuclear Power provides you with Ghost Agents for each World War card played. Worldwide Bank extends your ability to reach distant cards further down the Infiltration Zone. World, Inc. returns your Agents back from missions and generates Influence for every Project you participate in.

PLAYERS

All Modules are suitable for 1 to 5 players. Detailed solo play rules are provided in the rules for each of the Modules.

Name: Salvage Hidden Treasures
Description:
Welcome to Salvage Hidden Treasures, the game where you take the helm as Salvage Ship Captains aboard the treacherous high seas. Throughout 16 rounds, you and your rivals will discover and salvage treasure from the depths of the ocean. When the game is up the captain with the biggest haul of treasure will claim victory. Easy, except within the seven seas are pirates, sharks and other hazards lurking in the depths. A clever combination of strategy and good fortune will score you treasures that swing the odds in your favour and ruin the hopes of your rivals.

Being a salvage ship captain means fighting it out on the high seas, searching for treasure and owning the biggest haul at the end of the game. Starting with one ship, you will take turns discovering, salvaging and bartering for treasure tiles. Navigating your boats across the ocean, you will pay to discover what lies beneath the waves salvaging treasures to claim them as your own. You may want to think of investing some of your money into expanding your fleet from one to three salvage ships. Each boat can only hold so much weight!

Salvage Hidden Treasures is a turn-based strategy board game taking place over 16 rounds.
Each player’s turn has four phases:

     Income
     Market
     Navigation
     Action


But it’s not that simple. Among the valuable treasure tiles are twists and turns in the form of events, from pirate attacks to weird weather they will either benefit or scupper your chances of victory. The treasure itself also carries unique abilities that will change the shape of the game entirely depending on what you manage to discover and salvage from the sea.

Each game lasts for 16 rounds or until all the tiles have been collected. If you are in a 2-player duel or want more time at sea, opt for 20 rounds. The winner is the player with the highest combined treasure value indicated by the treasure chest on each treasure tile.

—description from the designer

Name: MiniSteel
Description:
MiniSteel is an ultra portable, quick-fix, battle royale strategy card game.

Players begin with 10 HP Tokens and 2 Card Draw Tokens to enhance their hand when they choose to use them. The highest rolled die begins.

With 6 cards in hand, the first player chooses to equip for battle, build up shields to defend for a future attack, heal, and/or attack an opponent, all opponents, or the whole table! After two actions, the turn moves to the player to the left until the last player standing wins the battle... unless someone has in hand the Revival Scepter.

The same game is never played twice and epic comebacks feel so, so  good!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Nutz Pro Golf
Description:
Monster drives, unbelievable hole-outs, sand saves, and mile-long putts for birdie...it’s all in here! Hit the links as your favorite PGA golfer and your results will depend on that pro’s abilities, your decisions, and of course, the luck of the dice. Will you choose to lay-up or go for the green? Drive for distance or play it safe? Or, Maybe you just want to play a relaxing round as yourself against the course...no card needed. Just grab your clubs (using the Club Selection Chart) and you’re off! Choose the right club for the shot and you will be rewarded.

It’s up to you to choose your golf fantasy with Dice Nutz Pro Golf!

—description from the publisher

Name: Diamonds for Water
Description:
Water is scarce and becoming scarcer every day! You and your team of experts has been called upon to solve one crisis after another across the globe. The countdown is on in Diamonds for Water, a new cooperative deck building game from Big Girl Games.

In each game, a team is made up of water experts who must work together to achieve a final solution to a region-specific water problem. Players begin with a deck of basic cards which are supplemented by purchasing cards from the Market. On each turn, the players must engage with a Conflict, and resolve whatever problems the water issue brings up. Then they gather the resources from the cards in their hand and take any of several actions: help their teammates, purchase new cards for their deck, invest diamonds in the Bank, or trade and spend currency to solve the ongoing Goal or Objective.

Players choose from characters with special Actions. They may be able to help their fellow players stay healthy, draw extra cards, or receive extra Food or Energy. Each character also has a Skill they can choose to use three times in a game, such as halting the countdown marker or digging through the Market draw deck to find elusive Water cards. While Food and Energy are plentiful, trading for Diamonds requires them to be available in the Bank, and getting them there can require some sacrifice for the team. However, team members can also Plant and Harvest left over Food as a way to raise the currency they need for more expensive items, such as Water cards.

In the world of the game, Water is actually more valuable than Diamonds. And it becomes more scarce as you play - a Countdown Marker shows how water is running out while your team tries to solve each problem. Let the Countdown Marker reach 0 without resolving each Goal and Objective, and your team loses. Fix the problems using Energy, Diamonds, and Water, and you win!

-description from designer

Name: War & Write: Pacific
Description:
War & Write is a series of strategic level paper and writing game. The second volume is "Pacific", which simulates the Pacific theater during World War Two. One player leads the Allies and the other leads the Axis. There are six rounds in the game.

Players write down his/her commands secretly and reveal at the same time. There are three commands, diplomacy, reinforcement, or operation. Player controls more Flag areas win the game at the end of the sixth round. If there is a tie, Axis wins.

-description from designer

Name: SLAPZI: SNAPZI
Description:
With numerous small thumbnails or "snapshots" of full-sized pictures on a card, try to find matches from your game cards faster than the other players. Be the first player to play all of your cards to win. The various "snapshots" are taken from the original "SLAPZI" game's full-size photos. It's a new take on the fast-moving original game, which you'll need in order to play this expansion.

INCLUDES: 60 double-sided snapshot cards that contain 18 different images snapped from the regular SLAPZI picture cards and instructions.

Name: Revolta em San Villano
Description:
Revolta em San Villano is a print and play game in the same setting as Eduardo Guerra's earlier game Heróis de San Villano. Players are superheroes who have to keep the order in their cit while trying not to upset the general population.

The game is a roll and write game in which players draw on a common city map. Using one of the five dice from a dice board, they can either draw various icons onto the map or trace a route through the city. A die that is taken from the die board is rerolled and added to a queue, while the first die from the queue replaces the one that was taken from the board.

When tracing routes to the icons drawn, players gain points for saving innocents, tracking down criminals and so on. But whenever their traces cross, the population gets more upset, and when the revolt marker hits the maximum, the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

Name: Dungeon Dare
Description:
Dungeon Dare is a fast paced, lighthearted fantasy theme press-your-luck dungeon delve card game for 2-3 players! You enter the dungeon with only your wits--NO Weapons! NO Armor!--looking for monsters, items, and gold which can be cashed-in to level up! The first player to reach Level 10 of the dungeon wins!

The gameplay is simple: draw a card and then resolve that card. If it is a Monster, you can attack it (and gain XP) or you can avoid it! If it is a Weapon or Armor, you can equip it in your inventory. If it is an Item, you can add it to your inventory. If it is Gold, you can collect it! It is is the Princess, you save her! After each draw and resolve, you must decide whether to continue in the dungeon and risk losing all the Gold and XP you have gained during the turn, OR to stop and exit the dungeon and collect all the Gold and XP you gained during the turn to cash it in to level up through the dungeon. The first player to reach Level 10 wins.

-description from designer

Name: Block Industry
Description:
"Looking for a game that doesn’t require lots of mental activity yet has the capacity to engage you and your friends? Meet Block Industry; a thrilling fast-paced dexterity game. Players race to finish each block industry quest and collects the quest card."

(Publisher blurb)

Name: SpaceShipped: The Dynasty Seal
Description:
Some of the Emperox's items are missing, and troops have been assembled to find them! For some, this is a great opportunity for profit, but for others, it's another reason to stay away from the Dynasty forces.

COMPONENTS

     5 Multipurpose cards
     1 Enemy card


SETUP
Set aside the Wealth, Starting Crew, Ship, and Equipment cards from the base game.

Sort the remaining base game cards along with any expansion cards into the following groups: Crew, Ships, Equipment, and Enemies.
Shuffle each group, then randomly draw the following:

     Crew: 3
     Ships: 3
     Equipment: 7
     Enemy: 1


Along with the cards that you set aside, these are the 18 cards you will use to play.


Released in the April 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble
Description:
The monsters of Earthshine are growing in population, and must decide who will get a coveted chance to lure heroes into dungeons, defeat them, and take their gold. Will you be the first to collect enough gold and be crowned king of the monsters.

Trolling for Trouble expands Button Shy's Earthshine universe and lets players take on the role of the monsters.

The base game comes with the Golem, Wild Shroom, and Troll allowing 3 players to play. Each month throughout 2020, new cards and the wallet were released, allowing additional players (new monsters) and variety (new bosses, artifacts and heroes), until completing the full 18-card wallet game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Puerto Miau
Description:
Puerto Miau is a card game where players will have to fight for their fish at the table, if you neglect you can be left with nothing.

Deal the main cats and distribute the cards from the deck to all the players, each one will be able to play one card per turn. Your objective will be to collect as many fish in the area of your table, but do not give them up for sure since the others could try to keep your fish.

Use the defense card and fight for yours. You will also have cards with certain abilities that will give you an advantage during your turn or interrupt others.

At the end of each turn, draw until you have 5 cards in your hand.

The game is over when there are no more cards in the deck. Count the points of your fish and become the winner with the highest score.

-description from designer

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Shadow
Description:
A single card expansion that adds a new monster type and increases the player count.


Released in the April 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Ooze
Description:
A single card expansion that adds a new monster type and increases the player count.


Released in the March 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Judge Dredd: The Graveyard Shift
Description:
The Graveyard Shift is a set of solo play rules, scenarios and a campaign for the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game.

It follows the same format as the standard ruleset in terms of combat dice, however, the perps’ actions are found by rolling 3 combat dice and consulting a results sheet. which in combination with their current demeanor, dictates their actions.

Another cool addition is you randomly select perps to play against and which incidents and scenarios you play!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Judge Dredd Miniature Game (Warlord Games)

Name: 8 Bit Attack: Apocalypse
Description:
Vanquish the evil demons of the very apocalypse in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Apocalypse expansions adds 9 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Spider Mastermind!

Name: 8 Bit Attack: Hyperspeed
Description:
Blast through hyperspace as a star faring hero and battle aliens from across the cosmos in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Hyperspeed expansion adds 11 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Galaxy Eel

Name: 8 Bit Attack: Mythic Legends
Description:
Become a mighty hero of myth and then battle the monsters of myth and legends in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Mythic Legends expansion adds 12 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Mad God!

Name: 8 Bit Attack: Yog-Sothothery
Description:
Battle the evil cultists and monsters of the Cthulhu Mythos in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Yog-Sothothery expansion adds 9 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – Azathoth!

Name: 8 Bit Attack: Happy Halloween
Description:
Extra ghoolish heroes and monsters to make your 8-Bit Attack adventure even better! Happy Halloween is the only PG exclusive on this Kickstarter!

The Happy Halloween expansion adds 8 new heroes based on classic movie monsters, 5 new enemies, plus a new final boss - none other than Count Dracula himself!

Name: 5.15: A Rock Climbing Card Game
Description:
You begin 5.15 as a 5.7 climber, a long way from being able to complete a 5.15 -- one of the hardest climbs in the world.

Start by picking your Style: sport, boulder, trad, or alpine. Then build up your strength by sending easier climbs alone and with partners. Along the way you will build up your stash of personal Gear, adding to your climbing strength and protecting you from bad Weather and Setbacks (from your so-called friends).

The first player to send a 5.15 wins the game!

5.15 comes with forty rock climbs and eight 5.15 climbs so you can explore and adventure all over the world. There are also 102 Booty cards: Actions, Setbacks, Weather, and Gear (shoes, harnesses, clothing, everything you need to get outside!). Four styles let you explore different playstyles every game.

5.15 was funded on Kickstarter in fall 2020 and is available for pre-order on five15game.com

Name: Dream On!: Afternoon Nap Version
Description:
This version is a "taster" format, affectionately named "Afternoon Nap Version", featuring 56 of the 156 cards of the original game. Released during the COVID-19 pandemic as a freebie to help people cope with the isolation.

Dreams can be vivid, as if they're actually happening — but when they end, they can be hard to remember. With a little luck, and some careful communication with friends, a dream can be something that's cherished forever.

Dream On! is a collective storytelling game in which players create a dream together. Using the dream cards, they have two minutes to create a dream story. When the timer runs out, they then have to remember what happened in the dream and in what order. They score points for getting the details correct. At the end of the game, they tally up their score to see how much of their collective dream they've remembered.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Oxford Opoly
Description:
A fun game celebrating the home of Miami University.

The game includes:

Tokens: shoe, heart, smile, hand, dog, pretzel.

Locations: Ghost of Fisher Hall, The Water Tower, High Street, Temple Barber Shop, Bikewise, Farmer's Market, Oxford Coffee Company, Wild Berry, Oxford Lanes, Bagel & Deli, Bruno's Pizza, Mac & Joe's, Indian Ridge Golf Course, Aquatic Center, Talawanda High School, Pefer Park, The Goggin, Oxford Country Club.

Name: Rube
Description:
Reuben "Rube" Goldberg was an American cartoonist, sculptor, author, engineer, and inventor, remembered today for his cartoons depicting needlessly elaborate contraptions that perform simple tasks. These intricate collections of springs, pulleys, marbles, and countless other components are at once pointless and fascinating, silly and inspiring.

Summon your inner Rube Goldberg to help you score points in a 2-player, 9-card game that challenges you to make amazingly point-filled but still pointless, machines.


Released in the March 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Dragon Fruit
Description:
The Mysterious Dragon Fruit is not what you think. This new species of scaly trees and miraculous fruit is both familiar and foreign. How then should you cultivate the best orchard? Will you carefully plan to grow massive trees for bonus points? Or will you rush to the finish and leave fellow planters holding too many spiny seeds to profit from their plantings?

Dragon Fruit is a card game for 1-4 players where players attempt to grow the best orchard of exotic fruits.

Players select a numbered Dragon Fruit from their card each turn to play secretly and simultaneously. The value of card played determines turn order for the round. Players will plant and/or grow trees each round making already planted trees taller by playing higher valued cards. They will also collect new saplings from a communal area. Turn order is especially important when collecting saplings as some will not be available until others are removed.

The game ends when any player plays their last card or the supply of saplings runs out.

At the end of the game players score their planted trees with bonus points for tall trees and penalties for saplings left in their hand.

-description from designer

Name: これっくらいのお弁当箱に(In this OBENTO Box!)
Description:
A mail appeared suddenly on Mama's cellphone. It's from another mum who has her son in the same school as you. Did you know our sons have a school trip tomorrow? What? Tomorrow?! He didn't say anything to me! I need to prepare a lunch box with whatever now!

Players are playing the part of the mothers who need to prepare lunch-box with aleatory foods from their fridge.
Each player have a player mat where they need to place food cards on. On each cards are written some Victory Points that will be counted at the end of the game but also, in case of a food that has a smell, contains liquid or its color, will have bad influence and decrease VP of the adjacent card.

To prevent this bad influence, you will be able to put some foliage between those cards. You will also need to put ice cards adjacent to food that needs to be kept cold.

At the end of the game each player count their VP and get a bonus if they got all the cards colors and/or they manage to fill up all the entire bento box area.

Name: War & Write: America
Description:
War & Write is a series of strategic level writing game.  The third volume is "America", which simulates the hypothetical America theater during World War Two.  One player leads the Allies and the other leads the Axis.  There are six rounds in the game.

Players write down his/her commands secretly and reveal at the same time.  There are three commands, diplomacy, reinforcement, or operation.  Player controls more Flag areas win the game at the end of the sixth round.  If there is a tie, Axis wins.

Name: Jetpack Joyride: Party Expansion
Description:
The Party Expansion allows 2 more players to join the race!
Contains 25 additional polyomino tiles, 6 unique Gadgets and 8 unique Lab cards. It contains both English and French versions of the cards.

Name: Test of Honour: The Samurai MIniatures Game – Sohei Temple Guard
Description:
Led by Superior Saburo, the fierce Sohei warrior monks defend their sacred temple-fortresses to the last.

Mounted Sohei Superior Saburo
    Sohei Sergeant
    Sohei Creed Bearer
    Sohei Temple Guard with nodachi heavy sword
    Sohei Temple Guard with tetsubo heavy club
    Sohei Temple Guard with paired swords
    9 Recruitment Cards
    1 Trait Card
    6 Skill Cards
    2 Quest Cards
    MDF bases

The warriors represented in this box can be used with other Sohei forces, Ikko Ikki rebels, as well as allied samurai clans. These zealous believers do not fear death and fight even harder if their brethren are slain.

Superior Saburo leads the defence of the temple-fortress, galloping at his enemies to deliver a devasting one-off attack with the Dive Strike card.

The Sohei sergeant can send his troops surging forward in a sudden wave (or unleash a sudden blast of gunfire if you use him as a gunnery sergeaant) - a definite contrast to the steady ashigaru of the clans.

Meanwhile the Creed Bearer carries a banner daubed with inspiring prayers and religious slogans, making it more likely for nearby believers to trigger their Strike bonuses.

The devout Temple Guards themselves are the toughest fighters, hand-picked from among the warrior monks and able to shrug off minor injuries and carry on the battle unaffected. You can make them even harder to defeat with the Final Guardians trait!

Skill cards include Holy Relic, Hallowed Walls and Power from Grief.

Box contains 18 gaming cards for Test of Honour and 6 metal miniatures plus bases.

—description from the publisher

Name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Sohei Fanatics
Description:
This set contains:

3 Sohei Fanatics
    1 Recruitment card
    1 Trait card
    1 Skill card
    1 Multi-base

Sohei Fanatics are elite warrior monks, highly skilled with the naginata and filled with divine fervour.

Give them the Unstoppable Frenzy trait to make them even more devastating during Follow Up attacks. The Righteous Slaughter skill has a similar effect for a character.

These miniatures can also be fielded as 'standard' Sohei warrior monks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Sohei Musketmen
Description:
This set contains:

3 Sohei Musketmen
    1 Recruitment card
    1 Trait card
    1 Skill card
    1 Multi-base

Sohei warrior monks armed with muskets battle against the foes of their temple.

The Reckless Shooters trait allows musket-armed troops to move faster but limits them to firing at the nearest enemy!

The Grab a Musket skill lets a character shoot with the gun of a nearby friend.

—description from the publisher

Name: Just Rhyme
Description:
"Looking for a fun party game of words, charades and rhymes? With over 1200 words including creating your own words? Get ready in this game of up to 8 players and see how fast you can rhyme every word."

(Publisher blurb)
